TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit MessageBinding extends System.Web.Services.Description.NamedItem

Docs.summary: Describes how abstract content is mapped into a concrete format.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This abstract class forms the base class for the following classes:
- <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.FaultBinding>
- <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.InputBinding>
- <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.OutputBinding>
## Examples The following example demonstrates a typical use of the `MessageBinding` class.
[!code-cpp[MessageBinding_sample#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.web.services.de_15_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[MessageBinding_sample#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.services.de_15_1.cs)] [!code-vb[MessageBinding_sample#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.services.de_15_1.vb)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each of the classes derived from the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.MessageBinding> class corresponds to a Web Services Description Language (WSDL) element (`<input>`, `<output>` or `<fault>`) enclosed by the `<operation>` element, which is in turn enclosed by the `<binding>` element. The <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.OperationBinding> class corresponds to that `<operation>` element in the WSDL document.
For more information about WSDL, see the specification at http://www.w3.org/TR/wsdl/.
